|ftname=Battleships of Germany |dykdate=14 December 2010 |dykentry=... that the [[German Empire|German]] [[battleship]] '''[[SMS Friedrich der Grosse (1911)|SMS ''Friedrich der Grosse'']]''' ''(pictured)'' was the [[flagship]] of the [[Kaiserliche Marine|Imperial Navy]] during the majority of [[World War I]], including the [[Battle of Jutland]]? |topic=War and military |currentstatus=FA |four=no |maindate=October 15, 2012 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WPMILHIST|class=FA|Maritime=yes|German=yes|WWI=yes|OMT=1|A-Class=pass}} {{WikiProject Scottish Islands|class=FA|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Ships|class=FA|}} {{WikiProject Shipwrecks|importance=mid|class=FA}} }} {{American English}}
==Merge== Support the merger.[[User:Cosal|Cosal]] 21:03, 7 July 2006 (UTC) :Easier to merge the content and convert the article other article to a redirect. [[User:Megapixie|Megapixie]] 04:43, 11 July 2006 (UTC) ::Support merger from [[SMS Friedrich der Grosse]], this title is correct. [[User:Scoo|Scoo]] 05:57, 17 July 2006 (UTC)
==Article name== de has the article title as (1912) - is 1911 right ? [[User:Megapixie|Megapixie]] 04:43, 11 July 2006 (UTC)
==Article title== Changed title, according to evidence that ss is the preferred English spelling: *[http://www.oldandsold.com/articles26/world-war-one-51.shtml Reproduced contemporary article] notice that the reproduction includes a [[cedilla]], which suggests that the reproducers had capability to render at least some "non-typical" letters such as "ß" *[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/scotland/1508009.stm BBC article] *[http://72.14.205.104/search?q=cache:nw2w30jWNu0J:www.pr-productions.co.uk/The%2520Man.pdf+Friedrich+der+Gro%C3%9Fe+-site:wikipedia.org+warship&hl=en&ct=clnk&cd=20&gl=us&lr=lang_en&client=firefox-a The Man who bought a Navy, by Gerald Bowman] Google Book returns: **[http://books.google.com/books?lr=&q=%22friedrich+der+grosse%22+warship&btnG=Search+Books "friedrich der grosse" warship = 30] This includes English works from beginning and mid centuries, plus contemporary works such as [http://books.google.com/books?id=Ob2k5aM15cEC&pg=RA2-PA355&lpg=RA2-PA355&dq=friedrich+der+gro%C3%9Fe+-wikipedia.org+warship&source=web&ots=i8ZLw693Pv&sig=QsrBsf6RLf1FB-OowvCwSPAe1bw The First World War: A Complete History, by Martin Gilbert] **[http://books.google.com/books?lr=&q=%22friedrich+der+gro%C3%9Fe%22+warship&btnG=Search+Books "friedrich der große" warship = 1]
== Title is written wrong ==
Hallo, the title was moved from [[SMS Friedrich der Große (1911)]]. That title was right, but now the "ß" was replaced by "ss", which is incorrect. Greets, --[[User:Star Flyer|Star Flyer]] ([[User talk:Star Flyer|talk]]) 21:12, 10 November 2009 (UTC)
:The ship's name is generally rendered as the title is currently spelled in English works, for example as in V.E. Tarrant's ''Jutland: The German Perspective'' and John Campbell's ''Jutland: An Analysis of the Fighting''. Our article naming policy is to follow established English usage; see the section above for evidence of said usage. [[User:Parsecboy|Parsecboy]] ([[User talk:Parsecboy|talk]]) 23:40, 10 November 2009 (UTC)
{{Talk:SMS Friedrich der Grosse (1911)/GA1}}
